name: dss_payments_sa2_q4_2017
title: DSS - Quarterly Payments (SA2) December 2017

legal.licenceType: Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Australia (CC BY 3.0 AU)

abstract:
Department of Social Services (DSS) quarterly payment data provides counts of payments by recipient type by Statistical Area Level 2 (SA2), December 2017. This dataset provides the number of payments during the December quarter (October-December) 2017. Data is by SA2 2011 boundaries.

The Department of Social Services (DSS) is the Australian Government's lead agency in the development and delivery of social policy, and is working to improve the lifetime and wellbeing of people and families in Australia. DSS' policies and services respond to need across people's lives ? looking after families, children and older people; providing a safety net for people who cannot fully support themselves; enhancing the wellbeing of people with high needs; assisting people who need help with care; and supporting a diverse and harmonious society. DSS supports people and families in Australia by encouraging independence and participation, and supporting a cohesive society.

Data was obtained from the Australian Government Data Portal.

For further details on payments please see 'A guide to Australian Government payments'.

Please note in order to protect individuals' privacy all counts lesser than 5 have been suppressed in the original data. For AURIN's processing of the data the following replacements have been made:
  • '<5' - has been assigned a value of '3' within the data.
  • 'n.p.' (not provided) - has been set to null within the data.

selectedAttributes.name: sa2_main11
selectedAttributes.title: SA2 Main Code 2011
selectedAttributes.description: SA2 Main Code 2011.

selectedAttributes.name: abstudy_living_allowance
selectedAttributes.title: ABSTUDY (Living Allowance)
selectedAttributes.description: ABSTUDY (Living Allowance) provides a living allowance and a range of supplementary benefits for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander students and apprentices.

selectedAttributes.name: abstudy_non_living_allowance
selectedAttributes.title: ABSTUDY (Non-Living Allowance)
selectedAttributes.description: ABSTUDY supplementary payments include Schooling A Award, Part-time Award, Lawful Custody Award and the Testing Assessment Award.

selectedAttributes.name: age_pension
selectedAttributes.title: Age Pension
selectedAttributes.description: Age Pension is a support payment for people who have reached the qualifying age. From 1 July 2013, the qualifying age for both men and women is 65 years. From 1 July 2017 the Age Pension qualifying age will progressively increase from 65 years to 67 years, reaching 67 years in 2023.

selectedAttributes.name: austudy
selectedAttributes.title: Austudy
selectedAttributes.description: Austudy is a means-tested payment made to full-time students and Australian apprentices who are aged 25 years and older.

selectedAttributes.name: carer_allowance
selectedAttributes.title: Carer Allowance
selectedAttributes.description: A supplementary payment for carers who provide daily care and attention at home for a person with a disability, severe medical condition or who is frail and aged.

selectedAttributes.name: carer_allowance_child_health_care_card_only
selectedAttributes.title: Carer Allowance (Child Health Care Card Only)
selectedAttributes.description: If a person does not qualify for Carer Allowance (Child) based on the level of care required, the child they are caring for may still qualify for a Health Care Card (HCC) if at least 14 hours a week of additional care and attention is provided.

selectedAttributes.name: carer_payment
selectedAttributes.title: Carer Payment
selectedAttributes.description: Carer Payment provides income support for carers who, because of the demands of their caring role, are unable to support themselves through substantial paid employment.

selectedAttributes.name: commonwealth_rent_assistance_income_units
selectedAttributes.title: Commonwealth Rent Assistance
selectedAttributes.description: Generally, to qualify for Rent Assistance a person must be eligible for an income support payment, ABSTUDY, Family Tax Benefit Part A, or a Veteran's service pension or income support supplement. To receive Rent Assistance, a person must pay or be liable to pay private rent (excludes rent paid to specified state housing authorities) above the applicable rent threshold, for their usual home.

selectedAttributes.name: commonwealth_seniors_health_card
selectedAttributes.title: Commonwealth Seniors Health Card
selectedAttributes.description: The Commonwealth Seniors Health Card is claimed by people who have reached the qualifying age for the Age Pension but do not qualify for a pension.

selectedAttributes.name: disability_support_pension
selectedAttributes.title: Disability Support Pension
selectedAttributes.description: DSP is an income support payment for people who are unable to work for 15 hours or more per week at or above the relevant minimum wage, independent of a Program of Support due to permanent physical, intellectual or psychiatric impairment.

selectedAttributes.name: family_tax_benefit_a
selectedAttributes.title: Family Tax Benefits Part A
selectedAttributes.description: FTB Part A is the most common payment to help with the cost of raising children and is paid per child. It includes a supplement per child that becomes payable after the end of the financial year. FTB Part A is income tested on family income.

selectedAttributes.name: family_tax_benefit_b
selectedAttributes.title: Family Tax Benefits Part B
selectedAttributes.description: FTB Part B gives extra assistance to single-parent families and to couple families where one income is low. It is paid on a per family basis and includes a supplement that becomes payable after the end of the financial year.

selectedAttributes.name: health_care_card
selectedAttributes.title: Health Care Card (HCC)
selectedAttributes.description: The Health Care Card (HCC) is issued to recipients of certain social security benefit or allowance payments.  Low-income earners may claim the HCC and HCC numbers will include those with a Low Income Health Care Card LIC.

selectedAttributes.name: low_income_card
selectedAttributes.title: Low Income Health Care Card
selectedAttributes.description: The Low Income Health Care Card (LIC) can be claimed by low income earners, HCC numbers will include those with a Low Income Health Care Card LIC.

selectedAttributes.name: newstart_allowance
selectedAttributes.title: Newstart Allowance
selectedAttributes.description: Newstart Allowance is the major payment for unemployed people who are 22 and over, but under the qualifying age for the Age Pension. Recipients must satisfy the activity test by seeking work or participating in an activity designed to improve their employment prospects.

selectedAttributes.name: parenting_payment_partnered
selectedAttributes.title: Parenting Payment Partnered
selectedAttributes.description: Parenting Payment provides income support for parents or guardians to help with the cost of raising children. Parenting Payment Partnered is an income support payment for partnered parents with a youngest child under six years of age. Parenting Payment Single is an income support payment for single parents with a child under eight years of age.

selectedAttributes.name: parenting_payment_single
selectedAttributes.title: Parenting Payment Single
selectedAttributes.description: Parenting Payment provides income support for parents or guardians to help with the cost of raising children. Parenting Payment Partnered is an income support payment for partnered parents with a youngest child under six years of age. Parenting Payment Single is an income support payment for single parents with a child under eight years of age.

selectedAttributes.name: partner_allowance
selectedAttributes.title: Partner Allowance
selectedAttributes.description: Partner Allowance provides income support for older partners of income support recipients who face barriers to finding employment because of their previous limited participation in the workforce. Partner Allowance has been closed to new entrants since 2003.

selectedAttributes.name: pensioner_concession_card
selectedAttributes.title: Pension Concession Card
selectedAttributes.description: The Pension Concession Card is automatically issued to pensioners and eligible allowance recipients to provide access to health concessions.

selectedAttributes.name: sa2_code
selectedAttributes.title: SA2 5 digit Code 2011
selectedAttributes.description: SA2 5 digit Code 2011.

selectedAttributes.name: sa2_name
selectedAttributes.title: SA2 Name 2011
selectedAttributes.description: SA2 Name 2011.

selectedAttributes.name: sickness_allowance
selectedAttributes.title: Sickness Allowance
selectedAttributes.description: Sickness Allowance is a payment made to people who are temporarily unfit, due to illness or injury, to perform their usual work or study, and have a job to return to or intend to resume studying when fit to do so.

selectedAttributes.name: special_benefit
selectedAttributes.title: Special Benefit
selectedAttributes.description: Special Benefit is an income support payment for people who are in severe financial hardship due to circumstances beyond their control and who are ineligible for any other income support payment.

selectedAttributes.name: widow_allowance
selectedAttributes.title: Widow Allowance
selectedAttributes.description: Widow Allowance provides income support for older working age women who lose the support of a partner and face barriers to finding employment because of limited participation.

selectedAttributes.name: widow_b_pension
selectedAttributes.title: Widow B Pension
selectedAttributes.description: Widow B Pension is an income support payment for older widows who does not qualify for parenting payment, have limited needs, and have lost the financial support of their partner.

selectedAttributes.name: wife_pension_partner_on_age_pension
selectedAttributes.title: Wife Pension ? Partner on Age Pension
selectedAttributes.description: Wife Pensions are income support payments for the female partner of an Age or Disability Support Pensioner respectively.

selectedAttributes.name: wife_pension_partner_on_disability_support_pension
selectedAttributes.title: Wife Pension ? Partner on Disability Support Pension
selectedAttributes.description: Wife Pensions are income support payments for the female partner of an Age or Disability Support Pensioner respectively.

selectedAttributes.name: youth_allowance_other
selectedAttributes.title: Youth Allowance (other)
selectedAttributes.description: Youth Allowance (other) is the primary income support payment for young people aged 16?21 years who are seeking or preparing for paid employment.

selectedAttributes.name: youth_allowance_student_and_apprentice
selectedAttributes.title: Youth Allowance (student and Apprentice)
selectedAttributes.description: Youth Allowance (apprentice) is a means?tested payment for Australian apprentices and full-time students.
